captions.text: Kevin was in their cooking feel asleep on the couch and nearly burned down the cottage
Oh my god...I couldn't have been asleep for more than two minutes
for this weekend we decided we need to address

the outdoor cooking situation the
kitchens ridiculous we need to move the

cooking outside and this weekend we're
building a pizza oven
I'm Andrew
I'm Kevin
Welcome to Brojects!

For the pizza oven we're gonna
start with a charcoal barbecue around that
we're building our pizza station

to protect the wood from the intense
heat we're gonna need to make a heat
shield that surrounds the barbecue

after that we add a lower shelf for
storage and some wheels for easy moving
once we add the upper decking we'll carefully cut a hole around the barbecue

the biggest feature is going to be
our stainless steel insert

this will hold our pizza stone and give us
the high temperatures needed to make the
perfect pizza

then it's on to the extra features like
a custom pizza ingredients box
with insertable knives, hooks for utensils, a fire extinguisher and a pull out shelf
Start making the barbecue part
Once we get the table framed it'll go fast
So this is the beginnings of the frame...this is just structure
This is where the barbecue is going to be
We're going to deck this and then we're gonna cut a hole in it...the barbecues going to sit down in here
The legs obviously go down this way
So right now we're making up the wheel assembly
so we just need a spacer that will keep the wheels from coming in close
That's what this little pipe is going to be
The axel is going to go through this pipe

this is basically just gonna hold the
wheels apart so they don't come in on each other

now we're pretty much ready to get going
on this last leg
There's our frame
We've got a good big space in there to nest the barbecue

that cedar is so light
execution time big brother
Execution time big brother
Our heat shield is going to fit in here it's going to be attached to the top of the barrel
If this doesn't all line up this is going to look absolutely goofy

you don't want it to look weird, you
don't want giant gap on your
on your table...it would be nice if you could have it flush, but we're not gonna burn
or char are very, very flammable dry cedar
The moment of truth. Drum roll please!
This is a super moment of truth
we've almost got a barbecue
We want to keep that gap minimal
but we don't want to light it on fire
It just ate that bit alive didn't it?
Yea...more or less
It's just the material we're trying to drill through I think...stainless steel is hard
I haven't really worked with stainless hardly at all and I don't think he has either
so we're just kinda one of those things you find out as you go
Let's check it out
See if it fits
Super fail
We just made these little clips

So, its gonna come out and grab the barbecue
top
and hold it in place...it's nice and sturdy now...so we're good to go on that
I'm going to get ready to light it
Alright I'm going to start rolling out this dough
I should have really hit you there
Ok so now the charcoals in
We've gotta get the pizza stone on there to pre warm it
so it doesn't crack when we put the hardwood in, the hardwood is to get it to its real temperature
this is just to pre warm the pizza stone
Ready?
Success!
Just like the pros dude!
Not a bad shot
I think it's done
The chair ski worked it was a long

haul getting it up that thing is amazing it
needs some tweaking to get it perfect
Great project! Andrew got the chair out of the water and did a lot of skiing on it

place for the 'outdoor people'... if  you know what i mean ;D﻿

comments.author: Angelic Plays

comments.text:
+Angelic Plays +Philipp Hasse I am very sorry guys, I was stupid and wrong 
and I thought that they both made sense. I apologise and just want to say 
that you guys are right. Thank you for correcting me because I would've 
continued to use it wrongly. This is an honest apology. Thanks.
comments.author: Dan T

comments.text:
+Dan T Holy shit you're retarded.

Than is used in COMPARISON, THEN IS NOT!

He was comparing Missing a period and spelling like him.

He used then while he was comparing there fore. He was wrong.
comments.author: Angelic Plays

comments.text:
+Dan T Jesus fucking Christ, seriously how stupid are you? It does not make 
sense, since he used the word "rather" which always introduces a 
comparison, that - guess what - needs the conjunction "than" when standing 
as a single sentence to make that comparison possible in the first place. 
Now stop trolling already.
comments.author: Philipp Hasse

comments.text:
+Angelic Plays It doesn't matter in the case which was: "I'd rather forget 
a period then spell like him". It does not matter they both make sense. 
Don't you understand? Then and Than can both work in his sentence. I'm sick 
of talking to you now because you're obviously a very ignorant person who 
didn't pay attention in English class.
comments.author: Dan T

comments.text:
+Dan T No shit they both make sense, but in the context he but it in it 
doesn't. He obviously is saying he would prefer to "forgot a period" rather 
than spell like him.

Instead of Than he used then, making it the context change to he would 
rather miss and period and after that, spell like him.

They are two very different words with two different meanings.

*____________________________________*
Other things you shouldn't misspell.
They're = Contraction of they are
Their = possession as in "It's their's!"
There = as in "It's their's! They're over there"
comments.author: Angelic Plays

comments.text:
+Angelic Plays They both make sense. Go look it up in the Oxford grammar 
checker.
comments.author: Dan T

comments.text:
+Dan T Actually it does. 
Take this for an example. 

Writing I'd rather be shat on than be peed on.

But writing I'd rather be shat on THEN peed on.
comments.author: Angelic Plays

comments.text:
+Philipp Hasse Actually doesn't matter so I wouldn't be so cocky if I was 
you...
